means: [人名] [英格兰人姓氏] 黑尔绰号，快腿或胆小鬼，来源于中世纪英语，含义是“野兔”(hare)
[人名] [爱尔兰姓氏] 黑尔盖尔语姓氏的英语形式，来源于人名，含义是“凶恶，激烈”(fierce,sharp)

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这两个名词均有"兔子"之意。
means: hare ： 指生在森林或田野等处的野兔。
rabbit ： 通常指家中饲养的家兔。

sentence.Network_en: Monks shave their heads, as do devotees of the Hare Krishna movement.
sentence.Network_cn: 和尚要剃度，克利须那派教徒也一样。

sentence.Network_en: We can organise car rental from Chicago O'Hare Airport.
sentence.Network_cn: 我们可以安排提供从芝加哥奥黑尔机场出发的租车服务。

sentence.Network_en: This isn't the first hare-brained scheme he's had.
sentence.Network_cn: 这已经不是他制定的第一个愚蠢方案了。

list.abs: 北极兔(Arctic hare)， 是一种适应了北极和山地环境的兔子。北极兔肉味鲜美，毛皮珍贵，因此便成了人们猎取的对象。
伊芙代表三月兔(March Hare)-ALICE中两只兔子，其中的白兔以身上的怀表做判断而三月兔则无澄代表白兔先生(White Rabbit)-身上怀 …

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English hara, of Germanic origin: related to Dutch haas and German Hase

entry.def: A hare is an animal like a rabbit but larger with long ears, long legs, and a small tail.
If you hare off somewhere, you go there very quickly.

example.ex: ...an over-protective mother who keeps haring off to ring the babysitter.
example.tran: 过于爱护孩子而不断地跑去给保姆打电话的母亲

means.word_mean: 1. swift timid long-eared mammal larger than a rabbit having a divided upper lip and long hind legs; young born furred and with open eyes
2. flesh of any of various rabbits or hares (wild or domesticated) eaten as food
